MEMO OF UNDERSTANDING / SALES AGREEMENT

Bruce Wodder

November 30 – December 7, 2024

 

Please read carefully our company policies listed below. It is your responsibility to inquire about and fully understand change and cancellation policies regarding your travel arrangements.           

 

 

GROUND PACKAGE PRICING*: $4,100 per person (single occupancy)                   

 

 

 

INCLUDED

  • 7 night’s accommodations in Cuba
  • Daily breakfast
  • Meals as listed on the program
  • Professional, bilingual guide for listed activities
  • Local ground transportation for listed activities
  • Pre-trip departure information
  • Compliance with U.S. Treasury Department regulations
  • Speaker fees
  • Tips for local guide and driver
  • Admission to all museums and public buildings listed in itinerary
  • Coordination of all listed activities

 

 

 

NOT INCLUDED

  • Round-trip airfare
  • Cuban Visa (this can be purchased via your airline or through CET for $100 plus shipping and processing)
  • Meals and activities other than listed on itinerary
  • Individual hotel expenses (mini bar, room service, laundry fees, etc.)

 

 

 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

PAYMENT:

  • A deposit of $1,000 per person is due by 180 days prior to departure: May 30, 2024. Early deposits are encouraged to reserve your spot on the trip.
  • Full payment will be due 90 days prior to departure: August 30, 2024.
  • A signed copy of the Memorandum of Understanding should be turned in with the deposit.
  • Please inquire if you are interested in purchasing trip insurance from a certified, third party.

 

Payment can be made with a check, cashier’s check, or money order. Credit cards are not accepted.

Checks should be made out to Cuba Educational Travel and mailed to:

 

Cuba Educational Travel

Attn: Bruce Wodder

136 Sequams Lane W.

West Islip, NY 11795

 

CANCELLATION and REPLACEMENT POLICIES:

  • The sale is final.
  • Cancellations made more than 150 days prior to departure are fully refundable.
  • Cancellations made within 149-91 days of trip departure are eligible for a 50 percent refund.
  • Cancellations made within 90 days of trip departure are not eligible for a refund.
  • In some instances, time permitting, a different traveler can take the place of a scheduled participant for a processing fee of $350.

TRIP CANCELLATION INSURANCE:

Due to financial transaction limitations stemming from OFAC’s embargo on Cuba, the trip is non- refundable. We recommend Allianz Global Travel Insurance - specifically their Classic with RTW (Requirement to Work - allows you to cancel for work related reasons), Premier Plan or Classic with Cancel Anytime. The plans are based on individuals - so each member will need to purchase their own plan to cover their own per person trip cost.

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. Those without a valid passport and visa will not be allowed to enter. Travelers who were born in Cuba may require a special visa in order to enter the country. Passport should be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. You may obtain a visa from CET or the airline and CET will advise on the process.

 

IMPORTANT: Your trip is designed and implanted to comply with U.S. regulations on travel to Cuba as well as local laws in Cuba. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for violations as a result of travelers ignoring advice, altering programs on the ground or breaking Cuban law.

AGREEMENT BETWEEN ST. JOHN'S UNIVERSITY AND CUBA EDUCATIONAL TRAVEL
St. John's University Law School Travel Program
March 18-25, 2016

 

 

Please read carefully our company policies listed below. It is your responsibility to inquire about and fully understand change and cancellation policies regarding your travel arrangements.

 

INCLUDED

  • 7 night hotel accommodations in Cuba
    • 6 nights in Havana
    • 1 night in Viñales Valley
  • Direct flight round-trip Airfare New York – Havana – New York
  • Daily breakfast
  • Lunches and dinners as listed on the itinerary
  • All local ground transportation
  • Speaker fees
  • Admission to all museums and public buildings listed in itinerary
  • Coordination of all listed activities
  • Pre-trip departure information
  • Cuban Insurance (health and evacuation)
  • Cuban Visa
  • Compliance with U.S. Treasury Department regulations
  • Travel on the Cuba Educational Travel license
  • Cuban Airport Departure tax (25 CUC)

 

NOT INCLUDED

  • Airline baggage fees
  • Individual house/hotel expenses (mini bar, room service, laundry fees, etc.)
  • Tips to local guides
  • Meals other than listed on itinerary

 

 

 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

CANCELLATION and REPLACEMENT POLICIES:

General Provisions. The following schedule for cancellations and reimbursements applies, subject to a party’s right to cancel without penalty pursuant to the Force Majeure terms listed below:

If St. John’s University cancels:

  • Cancellations made prior to or on October 15, 2015 are eligible for a full refund of all amounts paid.
  • Cancellations made between October 16, 2015 – December 14, 2015 are eligible for a 50% refund of all amounts paid.
  • Cancellations made on or after December 15, 2015 will forfeit all amounts paid.
  • Substitution of Travelers. John’s University has the right to substitute travelers prior to the departure date without penalty, subject to any restrictions and fees imposed by the air carrier or the Government of Cuba.

In case of a cancellation by St. John’s, Cuba Educational Travel must make a good faith effort to minimize outstanding fees and costs.

If Cuba Educational Travel cancels the program (other than in a case of Force Majeure):

  • Cuba Educational Travels will return all payments made by St. John’s, subject to any restrictions and fees imposed by the air carrier.

Force Majeure. Notwithstanding the General Provisions listed above, each party reserves the right to cancel the tour without penalty prior to departure for the following reasons: Department of State travel warnings for U.S. citizens, natural disaster, political, economic or social instability, and acts of war, terrorism or God in Canada, the US, Cuba or neighboring countries (each a “Force Majeure Cause”). In the event either party cancels a tour program for a Force Majeure Cause, or for reasons beyond its control that could affect traveler safety and well-being, or render travel impractical or impossible, including without limitation the issuance of a travel advisory by the US State Department, all deposits and other amounts paid by either party to the other shall be refunded as soon as practicable, and in any event within thirty (30) days of receipt of the cancellation notice.

 

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

ASSISTANCE WITH ITINERARY ADJUSTMENTS:

Cuba Educational Travel will use best efforts to assist in the scheduling or rescheduling of meetings and events in the event that persons with whom we are meeting need to reschedule.

St. John’s University shall have the flexibility to modify the itinerary. Cuba Educational Travel shall use best efforts to accommodate changes to the itinerary requested by St. John’s University. St. John’s University will pay any reasonable and documented additional costs incurred due to the changes its has requested. St. John’s University is entitled to make reasonable minor changes to the itinerary at no additional cost.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. The visa will be completed by a Cuba Educational Travel representative and given to participants at check-in in New York OR sent to the trip leader beforehand.

 

IMPORTANT: Those without a valid passport will not be allowed to enter. Passport must be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. Passports must be U.S. issued. Foreign passports allowed only in conjunction with a valid U.S. Resident Alien card (Green Card). Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for lost or stolen passports in Cuba.

 

REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES:

Cuba Educational Travel warrants that it is fully licensed by all licensing bodies having jurisdiction over Cuba Educational Travel to perform all services required under this Agreement, is experienced and skilled in this type of service and is familiar and compliant with all applicable laws, regulations, codes, standards and guidelines pertaining to this type of service. Cuba Educational Travel further warrants that the services it provides pursuant to this Agreement shall be performed by qualified individuals in a professional manner conforming to generally accepted industry standards and practices.

Cuba Educational Travel shall obtain and maintain for the duration of this Agreement insurance of the types and at the amounts typically maintained by companies engaged in the same or similar business.

Cuba Educational Travel shall deliver to Assistant Dean Jeffrey Walker (walkerj@stjohns.edu), a Certificate(s) of Insurance evidencing Cuba Educational Travel‘s insurance policies. St. John’s University retains the right to review these insurance policies and cancel the program within 15 days of receipt of the policies (and be fully reimbursed) if Cuba Educational Travel is not, in the sole determination of St. John’s University, sufficiently insured.

 

MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS:

Governing Law. This agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of New York.

Entire Agreement/Modification. This agreement contains the entire understanding between the parties. Any amendments to, modification of, or waiver of the agreement must be in writing and signed by all parties.

Severability. If any provision of this agreement is determined to be illegal, invalid or otherwise unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining portions of this agreement will be effective and binding on the parties.

Waiver. The failure of the St. John’s University to enforce, at any time or for any period, any provision of this agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of such provision. Any waiver of a breach hereunder shall be in writing and shall not be construed to be a waiver for further breaches unless expressly stated.

 

 

RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENT

Cuba Educational Travel serves only to assist in making necessary travel arrangements for its participating members, and in no way represents, or acts as agent for, transportation carriers, hotels, and other suppliers of services connected with this tour. Therefore, is not liable for any injury, damage, loss, accident, delay or other irregularity which may be caused by the defect of any vehicle or the negligence or default of any company or person engaged in performing any of the services involved. Additionally, responsibility is not accepted for losses or expenses due to sickness, weather, strike, hostilities, wars, natural disasters or other such causes. All services and accommodations are subject to the laws of the country in which they are provided. Cuba Educational Travel does not accept liability for any airline cancellation or delay incurred by the purchase of an airline ticket. Baggage and personal effects are the sole responsibility of the owners at all times. Cuba Educational Travel reserves the right to make changes in the published itineraries whenever, in its reasonable judgment, they deem it necessary for the comfort, convenience or safety of the tour participants. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Cuba Educational Travel represents and warrants that it has only recommended and/or engaged those transportation carriers, hotels and service suppliers that (i) it has diligently researched and (ii) conform to current industry standards and are suitable for a program of this nature.

 

Cuba Educational Travel also reserves the right to decline to accept any person as a participant in the tours, or to require any participant to withdraw from the tour at any time, when such an action is for nondiscriminatory reasons and is reasonably determined by the appropriate Cuba Educational Travel staff representative to be in the best interests of the health, safety, and general welfare of the tour group, or of the individual participant.

 

The undersigned has read carefully the schedule of activities for this tour. The undersigned recognizes that there is a moderate level of physical activity involved in the tour and the tour may require participants to walk long distances and climb stairs. The undersigned accepts any risks thereof and the conditions set forth therein. The undersigned agrees to release and hold harmless Cuba Educational Travel and any of their officers or representatives from any and all liability for delays, injuries or death, or for the loss of or damage to, his/her property, except to the extent such delays, injuries, death or property loss or damage is related or due to the negligence or intentional misconduct of Cuba Educational Travel.

October 29-November 4, 2018

13-18 pax

19-24 pax

25+ pax

Double occupancy

$3,630 per person*

Single occupancy

 $4,050 per person*

INCLUDED

  • Meal reservations (as specified on the itinerary)

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

PAYMENT:

  • Payment will be made in two installments:
  • A deposit of $1,000 per person is due by 90 days prior to departure: July 29, 2018.
  • A signed copy of the Memorandum of Understanding must be turned in with the deposit.
  • Full payment will be due 60 days prior to departure: August 29, 2018.
  • Please inquire if you are interested in purchasing trip insurance from a certified, third party.

 

Payment can be made with a check, cashier’s check, or money order. Credit cards are not accepted. Checks should be made out to Cuba Educational Travel and mailed to:

 

Cuba Educational Travel

Attn: CHEF NICK BADOVINUS

72 Highland Ave.

West Islip, NY 11795

 

CANCELLATION and REPLACEMENT POLICIES:

  • The sale is final.
  • Cancellations made before 90 days prior to the trip are eligible for a full refund.
  • Cancellations made 89-61 days prior to trip departure are eligible for a 50 percent refund.
  • Cancellations made within 60 days of trip departure are not eligible for a refund.
  • In some instances, time permitting, a different traveler can take the place of a scheduled participant for a processing fee of $350.
  • If U.S. policy is altered to make it so that the trip is not compliant with U.S. law regarding travel to Cuba, a full refund will be granted. This will ONLY be the case if there is no legal avenue for travel to Cuba that would allow for the trip to move forward.

 

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. Those without a valid passport and visa will not be allowed to enter. Passport should be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. You may obtain a visa from CET or the airline and CET will advise on the process.

 

IMPORTANT:

Your trip is designed and implanted to comply with U.S. regulations on travel to Cuba as well as local laws in Cuba. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for violations as a result of travelers ignoring advice, altering programs on the ground or breaking Cuban law.
